city: Vyraleth, the Ringed Estuary, is a tide-girdled metropolis raised upon seven concentric causeways of basalt and leviathan bone where the River Vyra exhales into the Sablemere. Its streets drown and reappear with the regulated pulse of three vast tide-gates, and every watch is counted by bells and chain-song as the city inhales and exhales the sea. Founded 612 years ago by exiled salt-princes from the Dune Marches and memory-keeping monks fleeing a burning library, Vyraleth fused salt, glass, and mnemonic covenant into a singular economy. The Guild of Tidewrights engineered the ring system, granting ring-rights to households: inner rings buy safety from flood and levy rents and duties upon the outer rings, whose people live by wit and weather. Beneath the harbor mud, fishers swear they feel the slumbering ribs of an elder leviathan; when the fog called the Pale creeps upriver, locals forbid whistling, lest it wake the bone. Market days smell of brine, eel oil, and ash from the glass kilns; at low tide the floor-script of the Glass Parliament becomes legible and law is argued upon its shining letters, while at high tide choristers in the Basilica of the Drowned Star sing to saints whose names were drowned to keep them safe. Vyraleth’s dependencies are braided: upstream grain for coastal salt; sky-silk and wind-levies from the Aerie of Brass; beacons maintained by the Lantern Cartel for ships threading the Sablemere’s black teeth. Memories themselves are tithed: binding contracts must be deposited with the Order of Mnemos, who can reproduce an event for a fee measured in coin and days of remembered life. Legends whisper of a pact sealed with a fallen Drowned Star whose fragment lies beneath the basilica, and of a rival fragment hidden within a tide-gate’s heart. Politics surge like tides: House Veyron seeks to restore hereditary salt-tithes, the Ratchet Syndicate contests drydock control, Free Wharfers agitate to end mooring dues, and the Tidewrights defend their monopoly over flood and flow. Vyraleth survives by constant negotiation between flood and stone, between old blood and guild charters, and between what is remembered and what is conveniently forgotten.

surroundings.name: Salt Spires
surroundings.description: A jagged crown of chalk-white pinnacles and honeycombed arches several leagues offshore, rising from a drowned plateau where waves boom like drumskin. Kelp ropes and barnacle ladders hint at hidden paths, and bell-buoys toll in the fog.
surroundings.legend: Said to be the fingers and teeth of a petrified titan who grasped the shore to climb into the world. When the Pale fog lies thick, a bell that no hand rings answers the Cartel’s beacons, guiding ships either to salvation or to a reef the titan still claims.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Smugglers of the Ratchet Syndicate; lantern eels; a hermit called Mother Shale who sells tidemaps inscribed on bones.
surroundings.resources: Salt-crystal blooms, kelp resin, coral dyes
surroundings.hazards: Rogue swells, false bell-tolls, sudden sinkholes in coral
surroundings.hooks: Recover a lost light-crystal belonging to the Lantern Cartel before a rival lights it and redirects a convoy to the wrong channel.

surroundings.name: Whisperfen
surroundings.description: A lattice of reeds and blackwater cut by slow silver channels and floating peat-islands, dotted with decayed pylons of some pre-flood road.
surroundings.legend: The fen drinks sound and memory; monks say a renegade Mnemos once poured a covenant into the waters, making the marsh remember secrets and answer questions with borrowed voices. Those who hear their own past across the water often step in and do not return.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Ghost egrets; reedcutters who tie knots to trap whispers; a ferryman sworn to speak only in others’ words.
surroundings.hazards: Memory-loss vapors, leeches that drink thoughts, bog-lights mimicking familiar lantern codes
surroundings.hooks: Find proof that House Veyron altered an oath by persuading the marsh to replay the night of a marriage contract.

surroundings.name: Skyhook Cliffs
surroundings.description: Black cliffs north of the harbor where wind-towers bristle and winches creak, hauling cargo by kites and gliders between cliff markets and river barges.
surroundings.legend: Chains sunk into the cliff face are said to be the cut cords of a Storm-King cursed to crawl; if all chains were ever rejoined, he would rise and drink the city’s winds dry.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Glider pilots of the Brass Aerie Collegium; cliff-urchins called hooklings; wind-oracles who read the gusts.
surroundings.resources: Sky-silk, windglass lenses, hardened tar for glider skins
surroundings.hazards: Shear gusts, snapped lines, aerial cutpurses
surroundings.hooks: A mysterious stillness settles over the cliffs; the Collegium offers a bounty for whoever finds who is siphoning the wind with illegal net-engines.

surroundings.name: Glass Orchard
surroundings.description: A field of lightning-fused sand trunks and branches that chime in the breeze, prismatic veins running like sap. Small pools between the trunks reflect the sky too perfectly.
surroundings.legend: Once a real orchard where a storm-bride’s dowry turned to glass when she fled her groom; beneath the largest trunk, lovers carve promises that cannot be forgotten and cannot be kept without price.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Hermit-craftsfolk who coax shards to grow; mirror-larks that mimic footsteps; a veiled penitent from the Tidebound Conclave.
surroundings.resources: Song-glass, memory mirrors, chime-shards for warding
surroundings.hazards: Cuts that bleed memory, mirage-thirst, echoing footsteps that lure wanderers deeper
surroundings.hooks: The Glass Parliament seeks a new seal made from the orchard’s root-glass to prevent forgeries of city charters.

surroundings.name: Ashwell Monastery Ruin
surroundings.description: Charred stones and collapsed vaults choked by ivy on a low hill inland; the air tastes of soot after rain, and carved gutters lead to a dry cistern painted with stars.
surroundings.legend: Said to be the first library of the Order of Mnemos, burned by jealous princes. In the cistern sleeps a well of names; if you drop your true name in, you may be forgotten by whatever hunts you, but your future must be bought back page by page.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Ash-moths; ink wraiths that copy footsteps; a gentle archivist spirit trading secrets for stories never told aloud.
surroundings.resources: Unburnable parchment, ember-ink that glows in truth’s presence
surroundings.hooks: Recover a page that remembers the city’s original flood treaty before House Veyron’s agents rewrite it within the well.

surroundings.name: The Rattle Dunes
surroundings.description: Rust-gold dunes that sing when wind combs their crests, dotted with bleached wagon-ribs and salt-scarred stones.
surroundings.legend: The dunes are said to ride over a buried caravan of the first salt-princes; when the moon is bitten by cloud, the dunes rattle with their bridle-chains, and those who listen can hear where treasure lies and where thirst waits.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Sand skinks called coin-tails; moon-bandits; a retired Tidewright mapmaker with a glass ear that hears sand.
surroundings.hazards: Glass devils that mirror travelers, thirst spirits bargaining for names
surroundings.hooks: A lost gear from a tide-gate prototype is rumored to lie beneath a dune that has not sung for three nights; Ratchet Syndicate crews are already searching.

surroundings.name: Leviathan’s Splay
surroundings.description: At the lowest ebb the sea recedes to reveal a plain of slick mud marked by arcs like ribs and deep sink-pools that breathe.
surroundings.legend: Fishers claim these are the bones of a sleeping sea-thing whose dreams dictate the city’s fortune; when gulls stand in a line upon the arcs, a storm is coming and debts will be called.
surroundings.notable_denizens: Mud-catchers; bone-pickers; a drift of white crabs attracted to songs.
surroundings.resources: Bone resin, eelglass, living mud used in tide-wards
surroundings.hazards: Sudden inrush tides, hidden whirl-hollows, oath-leeches
surroundings.hooks: The Tidebound Conclave requests escort to conduct a rare Night of Knots rite upon the exposed ribs to renew the city’s covenant.

buildings.name: Tide-Gate Crown
buildings.description: A tri-arched engine of basalt piers, brass teeth, and sky-silk curtains governing the river’s mouth; from its parapets, chain-bells and light-crystals signal the city’s pulse.
buildings.history: Raised in the third century after settlement by the first Tidewrights to harness flood and trade, rebuilt twice after stormquakes and once after sabotage during the Mooring Strikes.
buildings.dependencies: Cobalt gearstock from upriver mines, eel-oil for lanterns, sky-silk from the Brass Aerie Collegium, legal mandates from the Glass Parliament for closure orders.
buildings.factions: Guild of Tidewrights claims ownership; Saltwardens guard the control rooms; Free Wharfers protest emergency closures; Lantern Cartel coordinates beacons.
buildings.secrets: One of its heart-cogs bears a starshard set into a tooth, humming when the Drowned Star is invoked; an old flood-bypass tunnel runs beneath, mapped only in the Order of Mnemos archives.
buildings.conflicts: Ratchet Syndicate cells have attempted to seize gate levers during strikes; House Veyron seeks a hereditary right to appoint a Gate Steward.

buildings.name: Basilica of the Drowned Star
buildings.description: A barnacled dome whose interior is lacquered in deep blues and mirror-mosaic; channels in the floor let tidewater kiss the altar at high tide while choristers sing countercurrents.
buildings.history: Consecrated after the first great storm spared the inner ring; rebuilt after the Fire Tide when powdered salt burned blue for a day and a night.
buildings.dependencies: Pilgrim alms, choir schools sustained by House Veyron patronage, relic trade sanctioned by the Tidebound Conclave.
buildings.factions: Tidebound Conclave presides; Order of Mnemos confirms miracle records; Lantern Cartel supplies sanctuary lights during fog.
buildings.secrets: A submerged chamber seals a shard of the Drowned Star that resonates with the Gate Crown’s hidden tooth; a drowned saint’s bones act as a key in a song known to only three priors.
buildings.conflicts: Free Wharfers accuse the Conclave of hoarding donation grain during lean tides; the Brass Aerie Collegium disputes wind-rights over the dome for their glider lanes.

buildings.name: Glass Parliament
buildings.description: A circular amphitheater paved with etched plates of seawater glass that reveal etched law-texts and precedents only at low tide when sediments settle.
buildings.history: Founded as a compromise between guild charters and hereditary claims; a fissure from the Storm-Quake was filled with luminous grout that glows when oaths are false.
buildings.dependencies: Tide tables from the Tidewrights, transcription by the Order of Mnemos, guard detachments from the Saltwardens.
buildings.factions: All guilds argue here; House Veyron holds four seats; Free Wharfers hold a rotating commons bench; Lantern Cartel funds the lighting, influencing schedules.
buildings.secrets: A sealed annulus beneath the floor contains the original flood treaties; one plate can be reversed to hide text with refraction, an old trick of a Mnemos abbot.
buildings.conflicts: Sessions at the wrong tide have been used to obscure precedents; riots erupted when Ratchet Syndicate petitions were delayed past ebb.

buildings.name: Hall of Winter Ledgers
buildings.description: A cold, windowless slab with a roof of fluted lead and a central well where memory-ink is cooled; pale clerks in salt-gray handle contracts with eel-skin gloves.
buildings.history: Built by the Order of Mnemos to centralize tithe-records after the Ashwell fire; expanded into the ring of a dismantled kiln.
buildings.dependencies: Vats of memory-ink from Whisperfen, legal authority from the Parliament, protection by Saltwardens detachments paid by multiple guilds.
buildings.factions: Order of Mnemos rules within; Tidewrights and House Veyron maintain privileged scriptoriums; Free Wharfers maintain a noisy petition desk outside.
buildings.secrets: A ledger-leaf that remembers an erased marriage clause could topple House Veyron’s claim to inner-ring salt-tithes; a clerk siphons days of memories as graft.
buildings.conflicts: Free Wharfers accuse the Order of Mnemos of selling recall-priorities; Ratchet Syndicate attempts to steal tax-bonds to fund a dock strike.

buildings.name: Aerie of Brass
buildings.description: A needle of latticed brass and kite-bone ringed by glider gantries, humming with tuned cables; banners show wind-runes that nudge currents.
buildings.history: Raised by the Brass Aerie Collegium atop an old watchtower to capture and lease wind; expanded after a storm split their rival’s sails.
buildings.dependencies: Sky-silk wormeries, wind-oil for cable song, copper tithe remitted by pilots and cliff markets.
buildings.factions: Brass Aerie Collegium owns and governs; Lantern Cartel contracts for wind-pilots; Tidewrights resent their weather rights.
buildings.secrets: A hidden wind-heart stone stolen from a cloud temple lets the Aerie quiet whole districts; the Collegium masks outages as natural calms.
buildings.conflicts: House Veyron seeks to tax wind like water; Tidewrights and Aerie nearly came to blows when gate-banners caught on gliders.

buildings.name: Dry Dock Three – The Splay
buildings.description: The largest working dock, built along a fan of old bone arches; cranes stride like waterbirds and chains hang like a harp.
buildings.history: Once city-owned, it was privatized to cover war-debts and captured by the Ratchet Syndicate during the Mooring Strikes.
buildings.dependencies: Oak from upriver, iron from cliff forges, credit issued by the Brine Exchange, protection paid in drink and coin.
buildings.factions: Ratchet Syndicate runs it; Saltwardens patrol begrudgingly; Lantern Cartel maintains a pilot station nearby.
buildings.secrets: A smuggler’s chute drops into the bypass tunnel beneath the Gate Crown; a ledger of hush-money ties a Saltwarden captain to sabotage.
buildings.conflicts: The Tidewrights claim eminent domain during emergencies; Free Wharfers use the yard to unionize mooring crews, angering House Veyron patrons.

buildings.name: The Brine Exchange
buildings.description: A vaulted hall strung with salted ropes, where traders clip brass chits to lines to signal bids; floors are dusted in white to record foot traffic.
buildings.history: Founded by a coalition of salt-barges and sea-merchants to stabilize prices after a flood famine; later diversified into wind and memory futures.
buildings.dependencies: Trust in posted ledgers, Lantern Cartel convoy schedules, Parliament oversight to deter cornering.
buildings.factions: Saltwardens Consortium keeps order; Lantern Cartel posts charts; House Veyron brokers salt futures; Free Wharfers picket dues days.
buildings.secrets: A private room upstairs settles bets on fog arrival times using stolen Mnemos tide-dreams; a hidden trapdoor leads to a brine vault where counterfeit chits are cured to smell right.
buildings.conflicts: Ratchet Syndicate claims the Exchange fixes dock labor rates; the Parliament threatens seizure if insider trading of memory futures continues.

buildings.name: Leviathan Bone Bridge
buildings.description: An arched bridge of pale, ridged bone spanning a backchannel, ribbing casting striped shadows at certain tides that locals read like omens.
buildings.history: Legend says the first settlers dragged a rib from the flats to bridge the channels; shrine niches hold brass offerings for safe crossings.
buildings.dependencies: Resin coatings to resist salt-rot, Tidebound rites to pacify whatever the bone remembers, small tolls collected by bone-keepers.
buildings.factions: Tidebound Conclave appoints bone-keepers; Free Wharfers resist toll increases; Order of Mnemos records the rib’s omens.
buildings.secrets: Carvings on the underside map a passage beneath the city to the Basilica’s star chamber; the bone hums to a specific bell used only when gates fail.
buildings.conflicts: Lantern Cartel wants to hang a beacon on the bridge; locals say the light will wake the rib.

politics.name: Guild of Tidewrights
politics.leaders: Arch-Wright Sel Corvane and the Seven-Stepped Council
politics.goals: Maintain and expand control of the tide-gates, codify water-rights in their favor, annex Dry Dock Three by emergency decree.
politics.methods: Technical monopolies, licensing, oath-binding of apprentices, selective closures to prove necessity.
politics.assets: Tide-Gate Crown workshops, flood maps, a clandestine starshard-toothed cog, loyal crews in ring two.
politics.seats: A fortified blockhouse on the Gate Crown and a bench in the Glass Parliament.
politics.allies: House Veyron, Order of Mnemos (for record legitimization).
politics.rivals: Ratchet Syndicate, Free Wharfers Assembly, Brass Aerie Collegium.
politics.tensions: Accused of orchestrating ‘test floods’ to sway votes; internal rift between safety-first elders and expansionist young masters.

politics.name: Lantern Cartel
politics.leaders: Matriarch Luma Keel and the Beacon Circle
politics.goals: Monopolize navigation through the Salt Spires, set beacon rents, expand into longshore convoy protection.
politics.methods: Pilotage fees, charter contracts, light-code secrecy, sponsorship of salt festivals.
politics.assets: Beacon towers, foghorn barges, coded charts, trained pilots on every quay.
politics.seats: A light-chamber overlooking the Brine Exchange, voting shares in the Parliament’s schedule committee.
politics.tensions: Rumors that false bells at the Spires are their doing to punish unpaid dues; a splinter crew wants to unionize pilots independent of the Cartel.

politics.name: Saltwardens Consortium
politics.leaders: Captain Brask Ilyne and the Board of Tallymen
politics.goals: Keep docks open, stabilize prices at the Brine Exchange, suppress strikes that threaten schedules.
politics.methods: Bribes, privateers deputized as peacekeepers, selective embargoes, credit strangling.
politics.assets: Armored patrol skiffs, bonded warehouses, bonded bonds, informants in counting houses.
politics.seats: A garrison at the Exchange, an arbitration chamber in ring three.
politics.tensions: Accused of using oath-leeches to bind labor; internal feud between river and sea merchants.

politics.name: Order of Mnemos
politics.motto: What is kept, is kept alive.
politics.leaders: Abbatess Serene Khel and the Twelve Quiet
politics.goals: Maintain a monopoly on legal memory, prevent counterfeit recollections, recover the lost covenants of Ashwell.
politics.methods: Vow-binding, licensed recall ceremonies, tithe of days from oathbreakers, neutral arbitration in disputes.
politics.assets: Hall of Winter Ledgers, mnemonic wells, vow-scribes, black-ink that glows in truth.
politics.seats: A cloister bench in Parliament, sealed scriptoriums adjoining key courts.
politics.rivals: Free Wharfers Assembly, House Veyron when their past grows inconvenient.
politics.tensions: Whisperfen echoes challenge their authority; whispers of a schismatic cell selling memories at the docks.

politics.name: Ratchet Syndicate
politics.motto: If it turns, we turn it.
politics.leaders: Foreman Yarik Nine-Fingers and the Chain Circle
politics.goals: Control drydocks, reduce Guild levies, run an unregistered pilotage through the Spires.
politics.methods: Strikes, chain-sabotage, shadow pilotage, buying off Saltwardens, emergency repairs for ‘gratitude fees’.
politics.assets: Dry Dock Three, hidden chutes and lifts, strike funds, crews loyal to coin and cause.
politics.seats: No formal seats; a loud presence on the Parliament steps and in backroom exchanges.
politics.rivals: Guild of Tidewrights, Saltwardens Consortium, Lantern Cartel.
politics.tensions: A faction wants to go fully legitimate and buy a Parliament seat; hardliners call that betrayal.

politics.name: House Veyron
politics.leaders: Lady Maris Veyron and the Salt-Blood Council
politics.goals: Restore hereditary salt-tithes, claim the Gate Stewardship, secure marriages to bind guilds.
politics.methods: Patronage, debt purchases, arranged alliances, secret testimonies purchased from Mnemos clerks.
politics.assets: Inner-ring manses, salt futures, armed retainers, chapel rights in the Basilica.
politics.seats: Four seats in Parliament, influence over festival calendars.
politics.allies: Guild of Tidewrights, Saltwardens Consortium, sometimes Order of Mnemos.
politics.rivals: Free Wharfers Assembly, Ratchet Syndicate, Brass Aerie Collegium.
politics.tensions: Whispers that their founding oath was altered at Ashwell; a younger Veyron courts the Wharfers, risking a family split.

politics.name: Free Wharfers Assembly
politics.leaders: Speaker Nella Shuck and the Rope Circle
politics.goals: End mooring dues, gain ring-rights for outer wards, win a permanent commons bench in Parliament.
politics.methods: Human chains across quays, mass petitions, boat blockades, lantern boycotts.
politics.assets: Numbers, sympathy in outer rings, whistle codes, rogue printers.
politics.seats: A rotating commons bench when allowed, and the street outside Parliament permanently.
politics.rivals: Saltwardens Consortium, House Veyron, Lantern Cartel.
politics.tensions: Internal divide between negotiators and firebrands; blamed for a riot actually sparked by paid provocateurs.

politics.name: Tidebound Conclave
politics.motto: Bind the flood, unbind the heart.
politics.leaders: Star-Prior Alion and the Choir of Knots
politics.goals: Maintain the city’s covenant with the Drowned Star, regulate bone rites, keep shrines and bridge-omens pacified.
politics.methods: Processions, vow-knot rituals, song-law, sanctuary for oathbreakers who confess.
politics.assets: Basilica of the Drowned Star, rib-bridges, relics, choir-wards.
politics.seats: A spiritual advisory seat in Parliament, veto over ritual calendars.
politics.allies: Order of Mnemos, occasionally House Veyron.
politics.rivals: Brass Aerie Collegium during wind disputes, Free Wharfers when processions block work.
politics.tensions: Accused of hoarding alms; radicals want to publicly reveal the starshard to end factional secrecy.

politics.name: Brass Aerie Collegium
politics.leaders: Dean Orrix Vant and the Ring of Kites
politics.goals: Control wind-levies, expand glider lanes, experiment with bound stillness for storm defense.
politics.methods: Wind tariffs, weather augury, silk patents, silent strikes where the air simply refuses to move.
politics.assets: Aerie of Brass, sky-silk farms, wind-hearts, trained pilots.
politics.seats: A technical advisory in Parliament, the cliff guildhall council.
politics.tensions: Caught siphoning wind from Skyhook Cliffs to punish nonpaying merchants; apprentices flirt with Wharfers’ egalitarian ideals.
